arts.ttl: Bristol City player ratings as Robins draw 1-1 with Hull at Ashton Gate
arts.sum: The Bristol City number one couldn't do anything for the opening goal and then had very little to do for the remainder of the game. Bristol City Live is now on WhatsApp and we want you to join our community.

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles hails Hull City showing but coy over controversial referee display
arts.sum: "I think the highlight should be the way that we did things with 10 players, the way that we defended, the way that we played together, the way that we tried to stay in the game, to try to keep the three points for our side, and, we should not forget that we have a very good team in front of us and it's not easy to get points from here. Keen to avoid being fined for any controversial comments, Selles' frustration was obvious after seeing his side reduced to 10 men moments after Joao Pedro's terrific goal, with the striker given a straight red card for a lunge on George Tanner.

arts.ttl: Joao Pedro scores and sees red almost immediately as Hull draw at Bristol City
Ten-man Hull City earn huge point at Bristol City after Joao Pedro red card
arts.sum: City battled bravely to keep their lead intact until the interval, despite the hosts knocking on the door repeatedly, but unable to find a way through, that was until early in the second when Alfie Jones was adjudged to have fouled Sinclair Armstrong inside the box, and from the penalty spot, Anis Mehmeti made it 1-1. The game burst into life inside the first 15 minutes when City took a deserved lead through Pedro's wonderful turn and finish; unfortunately, within a minute, he was trudging back to the dressing room after being sent off for a reckless challenge just inside the Tigers half, clearly full of adrenaline.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings vs Bristol City as Ivor Pandur shines in battling point
arts.sum: City started really well and were deservedly in front after 13 minutes when Gustavo Puerta's through ball found Abu Kamara, and his deft touch into the path of Joao Pedro saw the striker turn brilliantly before sliding beyond the goalkeeper . Alfie Jones: Great tackle in the opening minute to deny Armstrong, and then should have fired City in front from close range.

arts.ttl: Hull City boss shines light on Bristol City duo ahead of 'difficult challenge' at Ashton Gate
arts.sum: Hull City manager Ruben Selles has shone a light on Bristol City duo Sinclair Armstrong and Anis Mehmeti ahead of the Tigers' trip to Ashton Gate this weekend. Despite recent signs of improvement, Selles is expecting a tough test in the West Country this weekend, with the Tigers boss picking out Mehmeti and Armstrong as two of Liam Manning's biggest threats at Ashton Gate .

arts.ttl: Hull City seeking Championship cushion as key man talks Tigers quality and relegation picture
arts.sum: Sean McLoughlin admits the Hull City dressing room was acutely aware of the size of the game on Tuesday night, and now they're determined to ensure a smooth end to the Championship season by stringing a run of results together. "We're at the business end of the season now, and if we want to finish on a positive note, these are the games that we have to be winning, obviously coming away from the Cardiff game, we knew that was a massive game, too, and we were all disappointed to lose that.

arts.ttl: Hull City's Championship relegation rivals Derby County seal surprise transfer deal
arts.sum: Hendrick, who last played for Derby almost nine years ago, has been without a club since his contract at Newcastle United expired last summer, but has been training at the club's Moor Farm complex for the past two weeks in a bid to build up his fitness. Hendrick says he turned down other offers both last summer and again in January, but the chance to rejoin the club where he made 214 appearances earlier in his career, was too good to turn down, despite their plight, which sees them seven points adrift of safety following City's win over Plymouth Argyle on Tuesday night.

arts.ttl: Hull City's season so far a 'disaster' ahead of Bristol City trip
arts.sum: Liam Manning's side are unbeaten in their last four Championship outings and have the chance to stretch their winning run to three games for the first time this season against Ruben Selles' side. Having moved level on points with sixth-placed West Brom with their win over Millwall on Tuesday night, Bristol City's attention now turns to Saturday afternoon's clash with Hull City.

arts.ttl: Matt Crooks return decision in Hull City's predicted starting XI to tackle Bristol City
arts.sum: The City head coach sprung a surprise on Tuesday night when he picked a slightly more attacking line-up for the visit of Plymouth Argyle, playing Kyle Joseph out wide and Joe Gelhardt in a central attacking role behind striker Joao Pedro. The challenge facing the Tigers on Saturday, however, will be an altogether different one with Bristol City in great form and sitting outside the top six on goal difference, having won seven of their last nine at Ashton Gate.
